RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TALENTED CORINNA chased toward the inside, eased out leaving the turn, dug in to take over past the sixteenth pole and drew away later yards. DEVIN ON EARTH took the lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, raced at the rail on the turn, was hand urged leaving the turn, gave up the lead past the sixteenth pole and just lasted for second. FIDDLERSHOTPLEASUR chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail, eased out past the eighth pole and just missed in an even finish. LATE NIGHT SPIRIT gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn, was carried out approaching the head of the lane but finished evenly. HOLY HIP gave chase, raced off the rail into the turn, drifted toward the head of the lane then ran evenly in the lane. EVERYDAYISAGIFT gave chase then faded in the three path on the turn. BODIE'S STORM raced well back saving ground. UNBRIDLED IRISH came away awkwardly and raced wide on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Fiddlershotpleasur
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,eased out past 1/8,just missed 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Hip
ENTRY.OWNER: C M Racing Stables LLC and Lewis Jalen

ENTRY.NAME: Talented Corinna
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Kim and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,eased out 1/8,up past 1/16,drew away later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Devin On Earth
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,rail turn,hand urged lane,caught past 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BESTLA pressured the pace, raced in the four path on the turn, drifted into the lane but dug in for the lead mid-stretch and edged further ahead later yards. CURLIN'S DOVE chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn, took a brief lead inside the eighth pole but was caught mid-stretch and relented later yards. GREAT DEVOTION chased through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn and dug in from the head of the lane to take third late strides. HEARDITALL chased outside, raced in the six path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. TAKE CHARGE LISA chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. ICY STARE took the lead nearing the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, contested the edge off the rail on the turn but was met passing the eighth pole and gave way. BROADWAY PEGGY gave chase to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin's Dove
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,brief lead past 1/8,relented later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Icy Stare
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge off rail turn,met past 1/8,gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ELLIES AT WINDSOR rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, raced near the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch encouragement and held on. I SHALLBE RELEASED rated off the pace inside, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn at the rail, dug in leaving the turn and finished well while gaining on the winner. ODINA stalked off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path then dueled through the stretch for third. IT'S A REAL HONOR saved ground, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for third. SNEAKY LYNK rounded the opening turn about the four path, left the turn outside, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, but flattened stride in the four path on the far turn. JUJU ON DA BEAT stumbled leaving the gate, rounded the opening turn in the three path and showed little response through the backstretch. LIL BUNNY entered the opening turn in the three path but faded through the turn, showed no response into the backstretch and was eventually eased.

ENTRY.NAME: I Shallbe Released
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 3/8,rail far turn,finished well,gaining

ENTRY.NAME: Ellies At Windsor
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured nearing 1/4,rail far turn,held on drvng

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 49. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLUESKYSLOOKINATME pressured the pace inside and took the lead on the rail at the quarter pole, drew clear midway through the turn and was kept alert in the lane. RIVERVIEW STEVIE was hustled to the lead past the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, gave up the lead at the quarter pole, dropped back midway on the turn and settled for second. EBONY QUEEN gave chase through the backstretch, entered the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. KIMSFAVORITESTORM chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little further. ARMY BEAUTY raced near the rail on the turn and never factored. JEALOUS MUCH dropped well back early.

ENTRY.NAME: Blueskyslookinatme
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,up rail 1/4,clear mid turn,kept alert lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TUSKEGEE CAT saved ground just off the early pace, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, dug in from the head of the lane and dueled through the final sixteenth to take over late yards. SULEMAN settled off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and finished well to take second the final yards. AMICALOLA FALLS rated close off the rail the first turn, closed to even terms three wide approaching the seven sixteenths pole and dueled from that point, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn and relented in the duel through the stretch. SCOOTSCOOT took over and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was met at the seven sixteenths pole and dueled from that point, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn and remained a factor to mid-stretch before flattening. AKINGISALWAYSKING raced in the six path the first turn, left the turn outside and picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path then flattened in the lane. BLISS THIS settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. POLITICAL DECISION rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the three path of the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Tuskegee Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid near 3/8,3p far turn,up late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Bliss This
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Amicalola Falls
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,even terms 3wd 7/16,dueled,relented lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE FEBRUARY 24, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since February 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HOLY DELITE rated the pace inside, came under pressure from the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. SHES SO SPEIGHTSY rounded the first turn about the five path and left the turn outside, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and came along to take second the final yards. FLAT DISCOUNT rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. CALYPSO GHOST raced in the four path the opening turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but faded at the rail on the far turn. SAX rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced in the four path on the far turn, but showed little in the lane. PRACTICALLY THERE veered out leaving the gate then angled toward the inside, raced well off the pace and showed little response through the backstretch. SHACKLEFORD COUNTY stalked two deep on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but faded off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Flat Discount
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,rail far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Delite
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured near 5/16,rail far turn,steady urging

ENTRY.NAME: Shackleford County
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2d,chased past 7/16,faded off rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race Since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 24 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORTES gave chase toward the inside through the backstretch, raced at the rail into the turn, eased out entering the lane and closed quickly to take over the final strides. BELLA MELA came away sharply and led most of the opening three sixteenths then pressured the pace toward the three eighths pole, contested even terms two deep on the turn, dueled clear nearing mid-stretch but was caught in the final strides. MACKENZIE'S MUSIC gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. CAJUN COUSIN gave chase inside, raced at the rail into the turn, angled out entering the stretch and dug in for a strong finish. TATOR MADE exchanged contact with Emberly and was shuffled back on the chute, picked up the chase outside, rounded the turn about the four path and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. GRANDIOSELY gave close early chase and raced in range of the lead in the four path on the turn, though flattened later yards. EMBERLY exchanged contact with Tator Made, was shuffled back on the chute and never factored. CASTLE LIGHTS dueled for the lead approaching the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, contested even terms at the rail on the turn then dropped back toward mid-stretch and weakened the final sixteenth. CASTLE TOY gave chase then faded in the three path on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Castle Lights
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled for lead,even terms rail turn,weakened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Fortes
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,eased out 1/8,gained quickly,up final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Grandiosely
ENTRY.COMMENT: close early chase,range 4p turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Bella Mela
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead,pressed pace,even terms 2d turn,clear 1/16,caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLUE N GOLD saved ground close to the pace, eased out and started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, took the lead midway on the far turn and dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage over the game challenge of NIGHT TRAIN WAYNE, who took over and moved to the inside to rate the pace, kept the edge over Strong Heart leaving the half mile pole and dueled from the three eighths, cleared that one approaching the quarter pole but was met by Blue N Gold at the rail midway on the far turn and dug in gamely, though, ceded to that one. MISS YOU AJAX saved ground off the pace, bid leaving the three eighths pole and raced in the three path on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and came along for third inside the sixteenth pole. RUN TO DAYLIGHT settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, then flattened in the lane. ROCK FILE saved ground well back on the opening turn and could only improve his position. STRONG HEART stalked off the rail on the first turn and loomed close into the backstretch, dueled from the three eighths pole but dropped back approaching the quarter pole and faded at the rail on the far turn. CHIPPEWA'S CASTLE raced in the three path the first turn, left the turn outside and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Blue N Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Funkhouser III, Raymond J. and Funkhouser, John C.
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out,bid 7/16,nod mid turn,determined lane

ENTRY.NAME: Miss You Ajax
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Rayan and Knoblauch Michelle R
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,3p far turn,eased out 1/8,along 3rd past1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Night Train Wayne
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,dueled from 3/8,met rail mid turn,game to wire
